alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 10:16AM EST until further notice by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Detroit/Pontiac MI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Michigan... River Raisin At Monroe City affecting Monroe County. Huron River Near Hamburg affecting Livingston County. For the River Raisin...including Monroe City...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Huron River...including Hamburg...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...River Raisin at Monroe City. * WHEN...From Monday morning until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:50 AM EST Sunday the stage was 8.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 9.2 feet early Tuesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Impact...At 9.0 feet, Flooding begins at the Monroe YMCA. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=DTX. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1030 PM EST.
